data.title: Small bug in platformAlignedAlloc
fix snappy and nvtt cmake
data.body: Fix snappy and nvtt cmake file considering upper/low case in Dependencies. Fix also variables used to build considering file and directory names

data.title: How to compile "raw" assets?
data.body:
Hi, Been following to the letter how to compile the engine and editor, it build and compile ok.

Some assets are missing, checked and I see them in the RAW folder, but it's missing the "compiled" version with the .asset

How can I create it? Is there a guide somewhere?
Here is the crash report:

> Banshee Engine Log
> 
> System information
> 
> Banshee version: 0.4
> 
> OS version: Windows 10 64-bit
> 
> CPU vendor: GenuineIntel
> 
> CPU name: Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-3770K CPU @ 3.50GHz
> 
> CPU clock speed: 3511Mhz
> 
> CPU core count: 8
> 
> GPU #0: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1080
> 
> GPU #1: Microsoft Basic Render Driver

> Cannot load resource. Specified file: C:\Users\Public\Projets\BansheeEngine\Data\Engine\Shaders\Transparent.bsl.asset doesn't exist.
> in class bs::TResourceHandle __cdecl bs::Resources::load(const class bs::Path &,class bs::Flags) [c:\users\public\projets\bansheeengine\source\bansheecore\source\bsresources.cpp:46]

I've created a repository from using the GIT command as mentionned on the github page, then build it successfully, then was able to compile it in debug (DX11). 

Note: Can I make it use OpenGL instead? Is the DX11 pipeline more recommended for the moment?

data.title: Banshee 0.4: Crash when resizing window
data.body:
I had a crash when I resized the editor window in Win10. 
This only happened one time, and is difficult to reproduce. It scale really well most of the time and my desktop is in 4K. Just to put a note that the application might crash when you rescale the editor window in rare occasion.

data.title: Can't rename items in the library windows.
data.body:
I was not able to rename an item in the library window.
Pressing F2 work, but can't complete the edit if I press "ENTER". If I click outside it revert to the old name.

I can rename properly in the hierachy window. Tested with 0.4

data.title: Éditor: Doesnt support accented character input in names (UTF?)
data.body:
Hi, Tried to name a folder inside the application and using accented characters. There are square brackets appearing instead of the desired character. Since there is mention the engine and editor support UTF internationalization, I wanted to report this as a possible bug. Characters like "Ééèèëäç" are not displayed...
Tested with 0.4

data.title: Fixed ScenePicking
data.body: Resolved some issues related to texture reading for the editor ScenePicking

data.title: Fixed several memory leaks and bugfixes
data.body:
Memory leaks fixes:

- Replaced the existing queue with a circular buffer in ProfilerGPU to store the reports to avoid size increasing indefinitely.

- Changed HString copy constructor and assignment operators to avoid orphaned memory

- Fixed ThreadPool not deleting some idle threads

- In FrameAlloc reset mFreePtr of the current block when clear is called, avoiding memory leak

Other fixes:

- ThreadPool not deleting some idle threads

- Typo in comments

data.title: Little problem with camera.
data.body: When the "near-plane" is changed to 0, the Banshee stops.

data.title: Any reason why you chose Box2D for 2D physics? Have you considered Chipmunk?
data.body:
Hello there. First of all I'd like to congrat on the awesome work being done here.

I just saw in the roadmap that you chose Box2D for the 2D physics, I guess that's because it's the most popular engine by far so you're just used to it, but have you considered Chipmunk?

In my opinion, Box2D doesn't really match the appeal of this engine because it feels old and it's missing some pretty important optimizations. Chipmunk has some quite neat and modern features and the spatial optimization (as long as you keep it reasonable) is in the worst case as fast as Box2D's, and in the best, when you fine-tune for your average objects, much faster (the engine could provide visual feedback for tweaking the settings). The important downside is the lack of speculative collision detection, but Box2D's is far from reliable and it's extremely slow anyway, which makes it pretty much unusable for a lot of use cases, to prevent tunneling on static or low velocity bodies, casting an approximate sweep shape between the physics world ticks is a much faster solution, and can be optimized to extremes, for example to a single raycast when preventing tunneling isn't that important.

Anyways, just a suggestion. Keep up the good work! :)

data.title: Add a Gitter chat badge to README.md
data.body:
### BearishSun/BansheeEngine now has a Chat Room on Gitter

@BearishSun has just created a chat room. You can visit it here: [https://gitter.im/Banshee3D/Lobby](https://gitter.im/Banshee3D/Lobby?utm_source=badge&utm_medium=badge&utm_campaign=pr-badge&content=body_link).

This pull-request adds this badge to your README.md:


[![Gitter](https://badges.gitter.im/Banshee3D/Lobby.svg)](https://gitter.im/Banshee3D/Lobby?utm_source=badge&utm_medium=badge&utm_campaign=pr-badge&utm_content=body_badge)

If my aim is a little off, please [let me know](https://github.com/gitterHQ/readme-badger/issues).

Happy chatting.


PS: [Click here](https://gitter.im/settings/badger/opt-out) if you would prefer not to receive automatic pull-requests from Gitter in future.

data.title: CMAKE generation issue
data.body:
Hi,

First of all, amazing job! Looking forward to getting my hands on the engine.

And with that purpose, I've been trying to generate a VS solution by using the instructions on GitHub but no luck so far. The issue seems to root from Standard Library files not being included in the build. I tried to fix it with my non-existent knowledge of CMAKE but couldn't figure out what's wrong exactly...

Here is the log from CMAKE:

_**Looking for BansheeSBGen installation...
...BansheeSBGen OK.
Generating script bindings, please wait...
In file included from 
D:\GitHub\BansheeEngine\Build\VS2017\Generated\toParse.cpp:1:
D:/GitHub/BansheeEngine/Source/BansheeUtility/Include/BsThreadDefines.h:7:10: fatal error: 'thread' file not found
#include <thread>
         ^~~~~~~~

1
 error generated.

Error while processing 
D:\GitHub\BansheeEngine\Build\VS2017\Generated\toParse.cpp.**_

If I skip the GENERATE_SCRIPT_BINDINGS option, then the generation succeeds but when I try to compile any sample project the process fails by complaining about undefined types:

**_1>------ Build started: Project: SBansheeEngine, Configuration: Debug x64 ------
1>BsTextureEx.cpp
1>c:\program files (x86)\microsoft visual studio\shared\14.0\vc\include\vector(1180): error C2036: 'bs::Color *const ': unknown size
1>c:\program files (x86)\microsoft visual studio\shared\14.0\vc\include\vector(1179): note: while compiling class template member function 'unsigned __int64 std::vector<bs::Color,bs::StdAlloc<T,bs::GenAlloc>>::size(void) throw() const'
1>        with
1>        [
1>            T=bs::Color
1>        ]
1>d:\github\bansheeengine\source\sbansheeengine\source\bstextureex.cpp(114): note: see reference to function template instantiation 'unsigned __int64 std::vector<bs::Color,bs::StdAlloc<T,bs::GenAlloc>>::size(void) throw() const' being compiled
1>        with
1>        [
1>            T=bs::Color
1>        ]
1>d:\github\bansheeengine\source\sbansheeengine\source\bstextureex.cpp(114): note: see reference to class template instantiation 'std::vector<bs::Color,bs::StdAlloc<T,bs::GenAlloc>>' being compiled
1>        with
1>        [
1>            T=bs::Color
1>        ]
1>BsScriptAssemblyManager.cpp
1>d:\github\bansheeengine\source\sbansheeengine\source\bsscriptassemblymanager.cpp(57): error C2027: use of undefined type 'bs::Texture'
1>d:\github\bansheeengine\build\vs2017\generated\engine\include\bsscripttexture.generated.h(8): note: see declaration of 'bs::Texture'
1>d:\github\bansheeengine\source\sbansheeengine\source\bsscriptassemblymanager.cpp(73): error C3861: 'getRTTIStatic': identifier not found
1>d:\github\bansheeengine\source\sbansheeengine\source\bsscriptassemblymanager.cpp(57): error C2227: left of '->getRTTIId' must point to class/struct/union/generic type
1>d:\github\bansheeengine\source\sbansheeengine\source\bsscriptassemblymanager.cpp(57): note: type is 'unknown-type'
1>BsScriptCSkybox.generated.cpp
1>d:\github\bansheeengine\build\vs2017\generated\engine\source\bsscriptcskybox.generated.cpp(23): error C2440: '=': cannot convert from 'bs::HTexture' to 'bs::INT32'
1>d:\github\bansheeengine\build\vs2017\generated\engine\source\bsscriptcskybox.generated.cpp(23): note: No user-defined-conversion operator available that can perform this conversion, or the operator cannot be called
1>d:\github\bansheeengine\build\vs2017\generated\engine\source\bsscriptcskybox.generated.cpp(33): error C2664: 'void bs::CSkybox::setTexture(const bs::HTexture &)': cannot convert argument 1 from 'bs::INT32' to 'const bs::HTexture &'
1>d:\github\bansheeengine\build\vs2017\generated\engine\source\bsscriptcskybox.generated.cpp(33): note: Reason: cannot convert from 'bs::INT32' to 'const bs::HTexture'

data.title: Solved C3861 __cpuid&__rdtsc identifier not found
data.body:
error C3861: '__cpuid ': identifier not found
error C3861: '__rdtsc ': identifier not found

data.title: Wrong CMake version in setup.bat
data.body:
I pulled (at  193af344096ed4f4e13dd3a161360457eba51b7a) and tried setup.bat, but I got a CMake version mismatch error:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2336052/24990760/0a50f04a-1fcb-11e7-923b-fc6e9e57e086.png)

data.title: Rename Module::isShutDown to Module::isStartedUp
data.body:
isDestroyed flag was set to true instead of isShutDown. 
Does not seem critical.

data.title: Incorrectly importing FBX
data.body:
there are two issues
1. model is broken - see images
2. crash if I try to import animation


model: [default_pose_char+wep.zip](https://github.com/BearishSun/BansheeEngine/files/737444/default_pose_char.wep.zip)

Correct bind pose in open3mod:

imported model in BansheeEngine:
